titleInfo.title: Brizendine v. City of Omaha, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER. Counsel appeared telephonically for R.16 conference. Progression of the case reviewed. Defendant is given until 1/31/2008 to file any motion for qualified immunity and/or motion for summary judgment. The R.16 conference is continued to 4/28/2008 at 9:30 A.M., by telephone call initiated by plaintiff's counsel.Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (ARL, )

titleInfo.title: Brizendine v. City of Omaha, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER AND NOTICE OF HEARING. Counsel's motion to withdraw 26 and accompanying motion for continuance 26 are set for hearing on Monday, May 5, 2008 at 11:00 a.m. in Courtroom 6, second floor, Roman L. Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 S. 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska. Timothy L. Ashford and plaintiff, Charles Brizendine, are both required to personally attend the hearing. Mr. Ashford shall, no later than April 23, 2008, serve a copy of this Order and Notice of Hearing on Charles Brizendine at his last known address. Mr. Ashford shall, no later than April 30, 2008, timely file proof of service showing compliance with paragraph 3, above, and listing the names and addresses of the persons to whom notice was sent. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (CLS, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cv-00277; Brizendine v. City of Omaha, et al;

Hruska U.S. Courthouse, 111 S. 18th Plaza, Omaha, Nebraska. Timothy L. Ashford and plaintiff, Charles Brizendine, are both required to personally attend the hearing. Mr. Ashford shall, no later than April 23, 2008, serve a copy of this Order and Notice of Hearing on Charles Brizendine at his last known address. Mr. Ashford shall, no later than April 30, 2008, timely file proof of service showing compliance with paragraph 3, above, and listing the names and addresses of the persons to whom notice was sent. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (CLS, )

titleInfo.title: Brizendine v. City of Omaha, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER. The Motion to Withdraw 26 is granted. If substitute counsel does not enter a written appearance in this court before the close of business on May 23, 2008 in full compliance with NEGenR 1.3(d), then the plaintiff will be deemed to be proceeding pro se, that is, without the assistance of counsel. Case Management Deadline set for 5/23/2008. Plaintiff is given a final extension of time until May 30, 2008 to file his written response in opposition to the defendants' pending Motion for Summary Judgment 19. The motion will be deemed ripe for decision on Monday, June 2, 2008. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (CLS, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cv-00277; Brizendine v. City of Omaha, et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER. The Motion to Withdraw 26 is granted. If substitute counsel does not enter a written appearance in this court before the close of business on May 23, 2008 in full compliance with NEGenR 1.3(d), then the plaintiff will be deemed to be proceeding pro se, that is, without the assistance of counsel. Case Management Deadline set for 5/23/2008. Plaintiff is given a final extension of time until May 30, 2008 to file his written response in opposition to the defendants' pending Motion for Summary Judgment 19. The motion will be deemed ripe for decision on Monday, June 2, 2008. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (CLS, )

titleInfo.title: Brizendine v. City of Omaha, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - Plaintiff's claims against the Omaha Police Department, Thomas Warren, Chief of Police, City Attorney Paul D. Kratz, City Prosecutor Marty Conboy, Omaha Police Officer Michael Curd, and Omaha Police Officer Brian Gerrity are hereby dismissed pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 41(a)(2). Defendants' Motion for Summary Judgment 19 is denied as moot as to these defendants. Defendants' Motion for Summary Judgment 19 is denied as to the City of Omaha and Omaha Police Officer Frank Platt, individually and in his official capacity. The plaintiff may file an amended complaint restating his claims against the remaining defendants, i.e., the City of Omaha and Omaha Police Officer Frank Platt, individually and in his official capacity. Any amended complaint shall be filed and served no later than October 15, 2008. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (KBJ)

The plaintiff may file an amended complaint restating his claims against the remaining defendants, i.e., the City of Omaha and Omaha Police Officer Frank Platt, individually and in his official capacity.
